result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan R. Gates was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The defendant's bond of $500.00 was applied towards the fine and costs.  The balance of $79.00 is to be added to defendant's current payment plan of $35.00 a month.

The jail sentence may be served with huber.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

Defendant Jonathan R. Gates in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs defendant of charges and penalties.  Defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to an attorney.  Plea of no contest.  Plea freely voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders a fine of $100.00 fine plus costs; DNA SC; 30 days county jail with huber to begin no later than May 29, 2015;  no operation of a motor vehicle until license is reinstated.   Appeal rights given to defendant.  - rt

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jonathan Gates appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $500.00 cash bond; booking; no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Notice of right to an attorney given to defendant.  Next court date is May 19, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.  - rt
